entry.title: Unbreaking testnet4
entry.summary:
In a recent update shared with the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, Antoine Poinsot announced the creation of a new Taproot web wallet specifically designed for use on Testnet4. This development is aimed at individuals interested in experimenting with Taproot, offering them a practical tool to explore its functionalities. The wallet supports various operations such as sending coins to an address or a Nostr npub, receiving coins from a faucet, and executing OP_RETURN transactions. Users have the flexibility to log in using either a hex private key or Nostr, catering to different preferences and security considerations.
Poinsot has acknowledged that while the wallet is operational, there might still be some bugs present. This candid admission underscores the developmental nature of the project and invites users to contribute by testing the platform and providing feedback on any issues they encounter or features they wish to see implemented. The initiative not only facilitates hands-on experience with Taproot on Testnet4 but also encourages community engagement and collaborative improvement of the tool. For those interested in exploring this new Taproot web wallet or contributing to its development, more information can be found at [https://testcoin.org/](https://testcoin.org/). This effort reflects the ongoing commitment within the Bitcoin development community to foster innovation and enhance the ecosystem's capabilities through practical tools and user feedback.
